core_values.evidence: Followed lawyer's advice completely - shut down project rather than risk legal problems. 'Don't register, don't start business, don't do anything'
LoRa technology for agriculture - remote field monitoring, no cellular needed. Technical solution to real agricultural challenges
Getting married, prioritizing stable remote employment over entrepreneurial uncertainty. Personal life phase takes precedence
'When war ends we need to be ready' - not rushing, but preparing. Understands timing is critical for success
Interested in Gaza drift tracker project for aid drops. Technical skills toward immediate humanitarian impact

interest_level.label: not_applicable_project_on_hold
evidence: Palexus completely shut down due to war
No revenue or operations to share percentage of
Focused on stable employment + marriage, not entrepreneurship
Cooperative model requires active business - not relevant now
interest_level.future_potential: If/when war ends and Palexus relaunches, could revisit cooperative interest

bloom_program_feedback.participation: Completed ACSI4 Bootcamp before war escalated
improvement_suggestions: Post-war entrepreneurship support pathway (not discussed but implied need)

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong technical skills, clear agricultural IoT vision, pragmatic decision-making. BUT: Project completely shut down due to war. Lawyer advised no business activity. Getting married, needs stable employment. No operations = no revenue to share. Wrong TIMING, not wrong fit. Similar to Salah (Blue Filter) - war/crisis survival mode not development mode. Future potential: If war ends and Salam relaunches Palexus, THEN reassess for cooperative.

recommendation.reasoning: Salam is NOT a bad candidate - he's a capable engineer with clear vision. But: (1) War makes business operations illegal/impossible, (2) Getting married = needs stability not entrepreneurial risk, (3) No active business = nothing to revenue-share on. This is TIMING issue, not capability issue. Like Salah, in survival/holding mode not development mode.
alternative_engagement: Stay connected - check in when war conditions change
Invite to humanitarian tech projects (Gaza drift tracker type work)
Post-war fast-track support: business registration, funding, rapid launch
Alumni network: keep Palexus vision alive, community holding space
recommendation.unique_value: Agricultural IoT / LoRa technology expertise, Palestine Ramallah representation, pragmatic legal compliance, post-war rapid deployment potential
recommendation.special_note: DO NOT interpret this as rejection. Salam is dealing with war conditions + major life transition. The cooperative model requires active business operations - he doesn't have that right now through no fault of his own. Keep door open for post-war re-engagement.

gaza_drift_tracker_collaboration.description: Bilal developing 'drift tracker' for Gaza aid drops - predict where packages land using ocean drift models. Salam has data integration engineering skills

specifics.project: Gaza aid drop prediction using drift/ocean current models
specifics.collaboration_potential: Technical contribution while Palexus on hold

gaza_drift_tracker_collaboration.action_required: Bilal follow up if drift tracker moves forward - invite Salam to contribute technically

post_war_agritech_fast_track.description: When war ends, narrow window to capture agricultural recovery market with IoT solutions. Salam wants to 'be ready'

specifics.market_opportunity: Agriculture will recover, need modern monitoring solutions
specifics.salam_advantage: Has technology designed, understands LoRa deployment

post_war_agritech_fast_track.action_required: Design post-war fast-track program - when entrepreneurs like Salam ready to launch, 30-day sprint model

holding_space_for_paused_dreams.description: Multiple Palestine entrepreneurs (Salam, Salah, partially Shaban) have projects on hold due to war. Need community that holds space for dreams without pressure

specifics.shared_experience: Business shutdown not by choice, but by war conditions
specifics.emotional_need: Validation that pause is okay, dreams still valid, community remembers
specifics.bloom_model: Check-ins without pressure, track when conditions change, celebrate resume-attempts

holding_space_for_paused_dreams.action_required: Create 'paused entrepreneurs' cohort - quarterly check-ins, no pressure, post-war rapid re-engagement plan

key_quotes.on_war_shutdown: The lawyer said: 'Don't register the company, don't start the business, don't do anything.' So I had to shut down Palexus completely.
key_quotes.on_lora_technology: LoRa is perfect for agriculture - it's long range, low power. You can monitor fields remotely without needing cellular infrastructure. That's what farmers need.
key_quotes.on_post_war_preparation: When the war ends, we need to be ready. I'm not giving up on Palexus. I'm just waiting for the right time.
key_quotes.on_marriage_stability: I'm getting married soon, so I need stable employment right now. The remote engineering work gives me that security.
key_quotes.on_gaza_drift_tracker: That's interesting - predicting where aid packages will land using ocean drift models. If I can help with the data integration part, I'd be interested.

strengths: Clear agricultural IoT vision with LoRa technology
growth_edges: Cannot operate business in war conditions (external constraint)
Solo founder - no team yet for Palexus
Uncertain timeline for resumption (depends on war ending)
meta_insights.unique_contribution: Agricultural IoT / LoRa expertise, Palestine Ramallah post-war entrepreneurship potential, pragmatic patience under crisis, humanitarian tech interest, data engineering skills
meta_insights.critical_insight: This is NOT about Salam's capability or commitment. War conditions + major life transition (marriage) make entrepreneurship impossible/unwise right now. He's in HOLDING pattern, not giving up. Community needs to hold space for paused dreams without judgment, reconnect when conditions change.
